author: Herald Staff
title: Bruins-Canadiens to be featured in NHL documentary on EPIX TV | Bruins Insider |
text:
Get ready for a deeper look inside the Bruins as they prepare to host the Winter Classic in January.
The NHL and the EPIX TV network announced today that the Bruins and Canadiens will be featured in a four-episode documentary detailing the the teams in the run-up to the Jan. 1 game at Gillette Stadium.
It’s the second straight year EPIX has produced a Winter Classic documentary, which was also run on HBO in past seasons.
Producer Ross Greenburg, who created the “Hard Knocks” NFL series that runs on HBO, described some of the unique access viewers will get from the series.
“Utilizing strategically placed cameras and microphones and a ‘you-are-there’ format, each episode will present a unique and unedited look into the players’ homes, locker rooms, training rooms and of course, the rink,” Greenburg said.
The series, officially titled EPIX presents road to the NHL Winter Classic, will be shown on these dates:
Wed. Dec. 16 at 10 p.m. Wed. Dec. 23 at 10 p.m. Wed. Dec. 30 at 10 p.m. Wed. Jan. 6 at 10 p.m.
